title: Ronaldo reveals the brilliant reason behind THAT infamous haircut at World Cup 2002
text:
Ronaldo reveals the brilliant reason behind THAT infamous haircut at World Cup 2002 Turns out it wasn't just a fashion statement, the hairdo served a purpose too... Share There's a perfectly good reason for this do Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
There are a number of secrets Ronaldo will take to the grave with him. 
Like how he managed to finish World Cup 2002 top goal-scorer despite going into the prestige tournament with an injury. 
But the secret of THAT haircut - you know the one we mean, the one he sported in the same competition - is now, finally, out in the open. 
For those of you who cannot remember, the haircut was a pretty special triangular wedge on the front of the front man's head. Not just a stylish look... (Photo: Getty) 
It looked pretty ridiculous, but there was a perfectly good reason why Ronaldo instructed his barber to go, well, wild. 
And no, it didn't scientifically help him head the ball better or anything like that, although we do like the way you're thinking. 
We'll let the Brazilian explain: It's all in the haircut (Photo: Getty) 
"My groin was hurting [going into the World Cup]. I was only at 60%. So I shaved my head," Ronaldo told ESPN Brazil. 
"Everybody was only talking about my injury. When I arrived in training with this haircut everybody stopped talking about the injury." 
What a genius!
